newsitem.title: USA: Intuit's InsureMarket starts U.S. policy sales.
newsitem.headline: Intuit's InsureMarket starts U.S. policy sales.

text.p: Intuit Inc said Wednesday it sold its first insurance policy on the Internet's World Wide Web.

In June Intuit, the developer of financial software including the popular "Quicken", launched a large site on the World Wide Web offering links to news, financial services and an insurance page, Quicken InsureMarket.
Since then, the InsureMarket has offered information and rate quotes from Allstate Life Insurance Co's Lincoln Benefit Life and Zurich Kemper Life's Zurich Direct.

"For the first time a consumer can get a free, individual rate quotes with no obligation, and make true online insurance purchases at our Web site," Steven Aldrich, president of Intuit's Interactive Insurance Services, said in a statement.
Other sites on the Web, such as Quotesmith provide rates or search databases for quotes, but InsureMarket is the first actually to sell policies over the Net, Intuit said.
In addition, John Hancock Financial Services said it has signed a letter of intent to participate in Quicken InsureMarket with quotes. Policies should be available at a later date.
